comments.commentBody:
Sooner or later the war crime part of this
conflict will emerge..

The USA must no longer support the
present Israeli regime; however the
Iron Dome should continue to be
funded..and hopefully will protect
Israel and its citizens..
The present Israeli regime should not
be championed or underwritten by
US taxpayers..

Israel cannot allow the soldiers who fought and died to have died in vain. The government must develop a strategic position that rests on these soldiers deaths and honors their deaths. I certainly hope so. The "international opinion" is fickle and will forget this quickly, this so-called opinion must not be the basis of concluding what has been started before it is satisfactorily concluded, otherwise it should never have been started. That is, before going to war there has to be an overwhelming reason to do so. Now that it has been done, after so much death and destruction, it must be finished in a way that removes Hamas as an enemy entity, and that allows Israel to continue to thrive. I hope that Israel does not give away in "peace talks" what it has sacrificed in this war.

@BBD SF
Right your are. As is the status quo Palestinian life is cheap as compared to those of the Jewish people. It is jusr not only indiscriminate killing of women and children, but collective punishment of the poor and innocent by bombing their homes and mass destruction is nothing more then war crimes cause of defending it self. As David Cameron the British PM said. Gaza is nothing but a walled in open air prison. And on all accounts this war is indeed a turkey shoot in a barrel Dick Cheney style.
For the 1.4 million Palestinians who have been occupied and imprisoned there tunneling is one way out of that inhuman prison, where Netanyahu and his greed creed chorts control everything including fresh water, electricity, wages, aid from the outside, and just about every way of life. Jimmy Carter was right when he labeled it apartheid.

Even before the state was established, the zionist leaders told foreign powers what they wanted to hear, while following their plan to conquest as much of Palestine as they could. Many recent historians have written about the above.

The aim of this war was to shut down the 'Peace Process' which was a sham to begin with and served only to prolong Palestinian servitude. A never ending process is exactly what they wanted. Obama/Kerry and EU got a bit serious, and Netanyahu is pushing back.
What do you suggest instead?  Collective suicide?

Far more Germans died in WW II than Americans. By your reasoning that would put the U.S. on the wrong side.

So if you're under attack, you have to sit on your hands until you have more killed on your side than they have? The Nazis would have taken over the world if America waited for its killed to exceed that of the Germans.

According to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties ,
about 8,000,000 Germans were killed vs. 420,000 Americans. Would you have sent over millions of Americans to be slaughtered to make it balance?

How about trying to understand the reason for this terrorism?  It's not like the Palestinians just woke up the other day and decided to shoot some rockets over the fence to kill some Jews.  Maybe being oppressed and harassed for decades, have your land taken away more and more, maybe those things have been driving the Palestinians to the point where they don't see an alternative ... And can you really blame them if you look at the full picture?

Jim: I am afraid that you don't speak on behalf of England any more than I do on behalf of the US. Your "question," which is far from original, reveals a certain level of historical illiteracy. If you wish to hew closer to the facts, then your question would be more along the lines of: how would you react if the family that owned the house you now occupy but was illegally thrown out (the Jews) came back to claim it, and even though you got the crooked cop on the beat (UK as mandatory power) to ignore the law (the Mandate for Palestine), they eventually were allotted space in the garden, though only 15% or so of what they'd been originally promised. by the new government (UN partition plan)  When you attacked them, they beat you and after you ran away, they got their house back.  Given the level of information you receive, I can well understand your confusion. You simply need to read more broadly and critically.

When the soldier was believed kidnapped there was massive artillery shelling of Rafah in order to prevent Hamas from carrying away their captive. Now the soldier has been reported killed in battle.

During the shelling about fifty Palestinian civilian deaths were reported. All these lives lost due to a wrong assumption by the IDF. No chance of any accountability for these killings of civilians, and a possible way for the IDF to break the ceasefire by pointing to aggression by Hamas.

Hamas is a terrorist organization using the civilians of Gaza as human shields to achieve their objectives. Does no one recognize the moral bankruptcy displayed by the IDF, when they show the same regard for civilian lives in Gaza, in achieving their own objectives.

Your sense of history is quite flawed.  And what of the millions of Jews who were dispossessed from every arab country in the middle east?  Who do they see to get their land back?  After 60 years, the Palestinians should have moved on and been welcomed into their neighboring countries, much as the Jews have for three millennia.  They moved on and made lives and vibrant communities for themselves until their host communities butchered and exiled them.  Israel deserved a home, too.
Any death in war is a waste of life but why do I know the name of the Israeli soldier and not the name of one child killed in Gaza?

"Time to stop bombing schools and hospitals and start planning for peace."

Very easy to say. Very easy indeed. Which of course is why you said it.

The West Bank settlements, right or wrong, are dumb. But there is no ethnic cleansing. In fact, it's down right astonishing how few Gazans have died. You don't warn civilians to get out of the way to commit ethnic cleansing. You don't make your own people human shields and then claim there is some kind of ethnic cleansing going on. Rwanda, where how many -- 500,000 to 1,000,000 were slaughtered -- that's genocide. What happened in Cambodia was genocide. Not what's happening now in Gaza. Please.
Bartolo: You left out the opening line, "Before Hamas could murder the Jews as proclaimed in their Charter". That's what you meant to say.
Please post the name of your firm so we can stay away, and our daughters, too.

I wish I could recommend this a thousand times. This woman is SO lucky to be able to have time with her kids and to still practice her profession--and to not be struggling economically to do so. It's a fantasy most working parents (myself included) would like to live out.  And instead, she is whining because she can't have more of everything.  Oy....

Working at two different career paths makes you stellar at neither!!! What part of that phrase have these wasted super moms not yet understood?  Any old cow can have calves, if one wants to be a research psychologist with grants from NIH, there are choices.  That is reality and the faster these wanna be super moms learn to live with it, the better off all of us including their children will be. Thanks.

What I got out of this piece: For you, the thrill of academic research is gone, and it took having kids to realize it. You're getting far more time with your children than any woman - or man - I know in the private sector. Working part-time at two different career pursuits (private practice, academic research) makes you stellar at neither. Listen to your heart, and go where your passions lie.
Oh my dear, you need to deal with your anger about this or it will eat you up. And no your husband does not have it all. It just looks that way to you right now.
So wise - thank you!
Thank you for this thoughtful and insightful piece.
Funny.  When I read that line I thought they simply filled that void left by her with their own ambitions!
not too shy about telling people what to do, under the disguise of "advice", particularly since it was not solicited in the first place.

This comment exemplifies everything that is wrong with attitudes around parental leave in this country. Are you truly suggesting that people (or just women?) who want to have children should not have careers? Or maybe this is satirical and I'm missing something.
"I wish that my house and lifestyle weren’t so much smaller and simpler than those of my close friends who stayed on competitive career tracks."  The horror!
Amen.
